alert.note: Alert for Grand (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 30 at 6:11PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Utah, including the following county, Grand. * WHEN...Until 915 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 608 PM MDT, satellite and lightning imagery indicate heavy rain from thunderstorms in Thompson Springs. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Thompson Springs is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. This includes the following streams and drainages... Tenmile Canyon, Salt Wash, Nash Wash, Dry Fork, Sagers Wash, Cisco Wash, Tenmile Wash and Little Grand Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Interstate 70 from mile markers 182 to 200. This includes mainly rural areas of Central Grand County and the intersection of Highway 191 and Interstate 70.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
